title: OpenAI taps former Twitter India head to kickstart in the country
summary: OpenAI has brought on former Twitter India head Rishi Jaitly as a senior advisor to help establish their presence in India and facilitate discussions with the government regarding AI policy. The company is also planning to build a local team in the country.
content:
OpenAI is working with former Twitter India head Rishi Jaitly as a senior advisor to facilitate talks with the government about AI policy, TechCrunch has exclusively learned. OpenAI is also looking to set up a local team in India.

The move comes as the artificial intelligence company seeks to expand its presence in one of the world's largest digital markets. Jaitly's role will primarily focus on engaging with government officials and policymakers to discuss AI regulation and implementation frameworks.

This strategic appointment signals OpenAI's serious intentions to establish a strong foothold in India, where artificial intelligence adoption is rapidly growing across various sectors including technology, healthcare, and education.
